multiple_choice.question: What is the brand name of the tissue product?
What scent is mentioned on the tissue packaging?
What color is the majority of the tissue packaging?
Which flower image appears on the packaging?
What feature is emphasized in the text 'UltraStrong'?
Which of the following best describes the packaging type?
What additional feature is printed near the Vinda logo?
What color are the flower petals shown in the design?
Which word appears alongside 'UltraStrong'?
What is the primary language used on the packaging?
Which of the following functions is directly described on the package?
What shape is the tissue opening on top of the package?
What is the accent color near the floral design?
Which feature enhances the tissue's durability?
What does the scent 'Orange Blossom' suggest?
Why is 'Super Absorbency' an important feature for tissues?
Why is the color blue likely used on the package?
What is the likely reason for showing flowers on the package?
What is the most prominent printed descriptor of the tissue's strength?
Why is the package semi-transparent in places?
What visual design makes the packaging appear fresh and fragrant?

options.B: Bright flowers and soft color gradients

multiple_choice.question: Why might 'UltraStrong' be a critical marketing term for tissues?

options.C: To emphasize tear resistance and durability

multiple_choice.question: What functional role does the oval slit opening serve?

options.C: Dispenses tissues one at a time efficiently

multiple_choice.question: What feature of the packaging helps consumers verify usage level?
Which of the following would best support the claim of being suitable for sensitive skin?
Why is the flower on the package specifically orange blossom?
What inference can you make from the logo placement at top-left?

options.B: It matches the layout design balance
options.C: It's where people first look when scanning

multiple_choice.question: Why is blue an effective background for white branding?
Which feature is implicitly suggested by the term 'UltraStrong'?
Why might flowers and scent be associated in tissue marketing?

options.C: To create emotional comfort and sensory appeal

multiple_choice.question: Why is plastic used for packaging this tissue?

options.B: It’s cheap and protects from moisture
options.D: It lets you heat the tissue

multiple_choice.question: How does the blue color help in visual branding?

options.C: It aligns with calmness and hygiene

multiple_choice.question: If a user needs durable tissues for travel, which feature would they rely on?
What would make this product less suitable for infants?

options.B: Its strong scent might be irritating

multiple_choice.question: What practical benefit does the floral artwork provide?

options.B: It distinguishes the product line visually

multiple_choice.question: Why is the product labeled with both Chinese and English?
Why is scent mentioned on the front and not the back?

options.C: It’s a key selling point that enhances appeal

multiple_choice.question: Why would a consumer choose this tissue over an unscented brand?
Which design feature would likely improve shelf visibility?

options.C: Large white brand logo on a blue background

multiple_choice.question: Why is 'Super Absorbency' useful in facial tissues?

true_false.question: The brand name printed on the packaging is 'Vinda'.
The tissue is advertised as 'UltraSoft' on the package.

The tissue is described as having antibacterial properties.
The packaging combines both Chinese and English text.

The package uses cardboard as its outer layer.
The tissue is scented with 'Orange Blossom'.

The flower image has pink petals and a yellow center.
The oval slit allows users to easily extract tissues.
The scent is mentioned only in Chinese characters.
There is no visible logo on the front of the tissue packaging.
